section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਰੇ ਜੀਅ ਨਿਲਜ ਲਾਜ ਤੋੁਹਿ ਨਾਹੀ ॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: O shameless being, don't you feel ashamed?

transliteration.text: rē jī nilaj lāj tōh nāhī .

melody.description: Gauri Sorath has a definite feeling of attraction and appeal, which woos the listener’s attention to the subject matter or target. However, the feelings of being enticed and lured are balanced with a sense of duty and realisation, of needing to obey the warning given.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:
Saint Kabir [1440 - 1518] was a Muslim mystic born in Varanasi in India, whose 541 hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. His writings about God are full of love and devotion, very direct and striking in appeal.

The birth of Kabir remains to this day shrouded in mystery and legend. Authorities disagree on both when he was born and who his parents were. One legend proclaims a divine virginal birth. His mother was reputed to have been of the Brahman caste and to have become pregnant after a visit to a Hindu shrine.

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

text: ਹਰਿ ਤਜਿ ਕਤ ਕਾਹੂ ਕੇ ਜਾਂਹੀ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: You have forsaken the Lord - now where will you go? Unto whom will you turn? ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: har taj kat kāhū kē jānhhī .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Gauri Sorath has a definite feeling of attraction and appeal, which woos the listener’s attention to the subject matter or target. However, the feelings of being enticed and lured are balanced with a sense of duty and realisation, of needing to obey the warning given.

translation.text: One whose Lord and Master is the highest and most exalted

text: ਸੋ ਜਨੁ ਪਰ ਘਰ ਜਾਤ ਨ ਸੋਹੀ ॥੧॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: - it is not proper for him to go to the house of another. ||1||

transliteration.text: sō jan par ghar jāt n sōhī .1.

section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: That Lord and Master is pervading everywhere.

melody.description: Gauri Sorath has a definite feeling of attraction and appeal, which woos the listener’s attention to the subject matter or target. However, the feelings of being enticed and lured are balanced with a sense of duty and realisation, of needing to obey the warning given.

section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The Lord is always with us; He is never far away. ||2||

melody.description: Gauri Sorath has a definite feeling of attraction and appeal, which woos the listener’s attention to the subject matter or target. However, the feelings of being enticed and lured are balanced with a sense of duty and realisation, of needing to obey the warning given.

text: ਕਵਲਾ ਚਰਨ ਸਰਨ ਹੈ ਜਾ ਕੇ ॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Even Maya takes to the Sanctuary of His Lotus Feet.

transliteration.text: kavalā charan saran hai jā kē .

text: ਕਹੁ ਜਨ ਕਾ ਨਾਹੀ ਘਰ ਤਾ ਕੇ ॥੩॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Tell me, what is there which is not in His home? ||3||

transliteration.text: kah jan kā nāhī ghar tā kē .3.

text: ਸਭੁ ਕੋਊ ਕਹੈ ਜਾਸੁ ਕੀ ਬਾਤਾ ॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Everyone speaks of Him; He is All-powerful.

transliteration.text: sabh kōū kahai jās kī bātā .

translation.text: He is His Own Master; He is the Giver. ||4||

transliteration.text: sō sanmrath nij pat hai dātā .4.

translation.text: Says Kabeer, he alone is perfect in this world,

text: ਜਾ ਕੇ ਹਿਰਦੈ ਅਵਰੁ ਨ ਹੋਈ ॥੫॥੩੮॥

translation.text: in whose heart there is none other than the Lord. ||5||38||
